comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1) AppleWebKit/535.7 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/16.0.912.59 Safari/535.7

Steps to reproduce:

Property, that in Firefox, is invalid. Please add support:
http://dev.w3.org/csswg/css3-images/
I beg to remove -moz-element property.
There needs to be a stable specification rather than an editor's draft.
comments.creator: moz@jeka.info
comments.text: There needs to be a stable specification rather than an editor's draft.
comments.author: moz@jeka.info

comments.raw_text: element() in css3-images is modeled off of -moz-element().  When the draft becomes stable we should update and unprefix it.
comments.creator: dbaron@dbaron.org
comments.author: dbaron@dbaron.org
comments.text: element() in css3-images is modeled off of -moz-element().  When the draft becomes stable we should update and unprefix it.
Alexei, to be clear this bug is waiting on the CSS working group to publish a stable draft of the feature.  We do have an experimental implementation already, as comment 2 says.
comments.author: bzbarsky@mit.edu
comments.creator: bzbarsky@mit.edu
comments.raw_text: Alexei, to be clear this bug is waiting on the CSS working group to publish a stable draft of the feature.  We do have an experimental implementation already, as comment 2 says.

comments.creator: john.p.baker@bristol.ac.uk
comments.text: *** Bug 728150 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
comments.author: john.p.baker@bristol.ac.uk

comments.raw_text:
(In reply to Alexei from comment #5)
> Stable draft: http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-images/

This draft is not stable. It's not even a last call draft (not to speak of a candidate recommendation).
comments.text:
(In reply to Alexei from comment #5)

This draft is not stable. It's not even a last call draft (not to speak of a candidate recommendation).

comments.text: Just an FYI that link was changed to Candidate Recomendation about a week after the last posts here. Its been in CR and unchanged for over a year.
comments.raw_text: Just an FYI that link was changed to Candidate Recomendation about a week after the last posts here. Its been in CR and unchanged for over a year.

"element()" has been deferred to Level 4. Adding Editor's Draft spec to URL field.
https://drafts.csswg.org/css-images-4/#element-notation
comments.author: moz@jeka.info
comments.text:
"element()" has been deferred to Level 4. Adding Editor's Draft spec to URL field.
https://drafts.csswg.org/css-images-4/#element-notation
comments.creator: moz@jeka.info

comments.raw_text:
My understanding is that element() should be supported as a value for the following properties:
* background-image 	
* list-style-image 	
* border-image-source 	
* cursor 	
* mask-image 	
* shape-outside 	
* mask-border-source 	
* symbols (as part of @counter-style (this feature is an at risk feature))
* content
comments.creator: eweyl@mozilla.com
